intro: Myrsine villosissima, commonly known as the silky myrsine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia and the Pacific. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many other shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its soft, hairy foliage, which gives it its common name. It produces small, white flowers that are often clustered together, followed by red, fleshy berries. Myrsine villosissima is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
